skill.name: designing-architecture
skill.description: Designs software architecture and selects appropriate patterns for projects. Use when designing systems, choosing architecture patterns, structuring projects, making technical decisions, or when asked about microservices, monoliths, or architectural approaches.
skill.summary: Designs software architecture and selects appropriate patterns for projects. Use when designing syst...
skill.author: CloudAI-X

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation about software architecture patterns. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. Content is entirely benign architectural guidance.

content.value_statement: Choosing the right architecture pattern is critical for project success but overwhelming given many options. This skill provides clear selection criteria, pattern comparisons, and documentation templates to make confident architectural decisions.
actual_capabilities: Recommends architecture patterns based on project size and team capabilities
Compares layered, clean, hexagonal, event-driven, and CQRS patterns
Provides decision frameworks for evaluating architectural trade-offs
Supplies directory structure templates for different pattern types
Offers validation checklists for architecture selection
limitations: Does not generate implementation code or project scaffolds
Does not analyze existing codebases for architecture issues
Does not execute or validate architectural decisions

use_cases.title: Select Architecture Pattern
use_cases.description: Choose the right pattern when starting a new project based on size, complexity, and team experience

use_cases.title: Document Trade-offs
use_cases.description: Use templates to document architectural decisions and communicate trade-offs to stakeholders

use_cases.title: Review Architecture
use_cases.description: Validate proposed architectures against established criteria and patterns

prompt_templates.title: New Project Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me choose an architecture pattern for a new [language/framework] project with [size] expected code and [team_size] developers

prompt_templates.title: Pattern Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare clean architecture versus hexagonal architecture for a [type] application and help me decide

prompt_templates.title: Migration Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: What architecture pattern should we use to migrate from a monolith to [goal] while minimizing disruption

prompt_templates.title: Trade-off Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me document the trade-offs between [option_a] and [option_b] for our [system] using the trade-off analysis template

output_examples.input: Help me choose an architecture pattern for a new Python web API project with 5 developers and expected growth to 50K LOC
output: Pattern Recommendation: Modular Monolith with Clean Architecture principles
Why: Balances simplicity for 5 devs with scalability to 50K LOC
Directory Structure: Feature-based organization under src/
Key Considerations: Define clear module boundaries, use dependency injection, plan for future service extraction

best_practices: Start simple and evolve architecture as requirements clarify
Match architecture complexity to team skill level
Document all architectural decisions and their trade-offs
anti_patterns: Over-engineering with unnecessary patterns for simple projects
Choosing trendy patterns without evaluating team capabilities

faq.question: Which patterns work best with Claude Code?
faq.answer: All patterns are compatible. Claude Code can reason through any architecture pattern described in the skill.

faq.question: What project size supports microservices?
faq.answer: Microservices add complexity. Consider when project exceeds 100K LOC and team has 10+ experienced developers.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my codebase?
faq.answer: This is a guidance skill. It provides patterns and templates. Implementation requires separate development work.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains no code execution, file access, or network calls. It only provides architectural guidance.

faq.question: Why did my architecture validation fail?
faq.answer: Validation fails when the selected pattern does not match project size, team skills, or scalability requirements.

faq.question: How does this compare to other design skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on high-level architecture patterns. Other skills may cover API design, database schema, or code organization.
